meanings.sent1: The birds flew southeastwards to escape the cold weather.
meanings.sent2: She pointed southeastwards to show the direction of the sunrise.
meanings.sent3: The cat chased the laser pointer southeastwards, thinking it was a bug.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed southeastwards, carving a path through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds gathered southeastwards, signaling an approaching rain shower.

meanings.sent1: They set off southeastwards towards the coast for a weekend getaway.
meanings.sent2: The hikers walked southeastwards along the trail, enjoying the scenic views.
meanings.sent3: The compass needle always pointed southeastwards, never wavering.
meanings.sent4: The sun dipped below the horizon, casting a warm glow southeastwards.
meanings.sent5: The scent of blooming flowers wafted southeastwards on the gentle breeze.

meanings.definition: Moving or facing towards the southeast.
meanings.sent1: The southeastwards wind brought a welcome coolness on a hot day.
meanings.sent2: The southeastwards side of the building offered a stunning view of the city skyline.
meanings.sent3: The southeastwards window let in the morning sunlight, brightening the room.
meanings.sent4: The southeastwards slope of the hill made it a challenging climb.
meanings.sent5: The southeastwards-facing garden thrived in the sunlight, blooming with colorful flowers.
